website_summaries.verdict: If you're short on space yet crave the huge image only a projector can deliver, the Viewsonic PJD7828HDL is worth a close look.
pros: The Viewsonic PJD7828HDL offers very good image quality for the price, with full HD resolution, a bright image and solid contrast
A short-throw lens helps it project a larger image in smaller spaces
There's a nook that's perfect for a streaming stick
cons: Somewhat lighter black levels and less accurate color than some more-expensive competitors

The projector is seeing to maximize viewing experience therefore there's no room to place a lens cap. Also if you calibrate your projector right you should not get any Rainbow Effect.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product, way underrated!
customer_reviews.text: Good price/ great value and performs even better than expected. I'll continue to purchase from Viewsonic. Underrated product. Forget having a TV when you can have a projector. I max it out at 120 inches and it comes in clear day or night, sometimes I close my blinds a little in the afternoons but usually don't even have to and I live on the beach and it's always sunny. I use this product in place of a TV and 6 months in and happy customer. really good HD and colors.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff Brown

customer_reviews.title: Has its' cons, but a good buy at the price.
customer_reviews.text: Have been using it over 2 months, and generally happy with my choice. You cannot go wrong with this in the price range. Pros: 1. Light weight and low fan noise. 2. Descent Picture quality 3. Lot of options to play around with in terms of Video mode. 4. Vertical and Horizontal tilting/shifting. Well, it's with all projector nowadays, but worth a mention. Cons: 1. Remote is not backlit, and hard to operate in the dark. 2. Sometime shows "No Signal", even though the receiver is always connected. Work around is to select the source again. 3. No USB powered port 4. Low volume compared to other projectors. (Does not matter for me, as receiver have this covered.)
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: This is a hard projector to get set right on screen size. It is a short throw projector and it doesn't readily say that in the description so check it first. I wasn't happy with the quality and the remote was cheap. We ended up buying a Sharp that was twice the price but so happy we did. It was easy setup.
customer_reviews.author: Barefoot Graphics

customer_reviews.title: Great projector. We use it for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Great projector. We use it for gaming, movies, streaming Chromecast. Everything looks good. It's a great deal for the price, we have not had any problems with it. Only issue is that the image is thrown up, the image is projected up from the lense. Easy to remidy, as we just mount ours upside down. Great value for the price.

customer_reviews.title: Remote control failed to work even with new batteries, ...
customer_reviews.text: Remote control failed to work from the rear, it will only work from the front of the projector. The unit has a front screw height adjustment but there is no rear left/right adjustable leveling feet, so you will have to prop one side up with something to make it level.
customer_reviews.author: IT

customer_reviews.title: Very good value
customer_reviews.text: In 2015 at this price you get a very good 1080p business projector perfect for spreadsheet work with 9 to 10 point font which does a more than decent job doubling as a casual home projector. Has 2 HDMI ports, mono audio out, small built in speaker, VGA in, VGA monitor out and some legacy connectors. Just add an inexpensive HDMI switch for. $50 supporting audio separation to digital optical audio out and you are fully set to add quality audio when needed. Only downside is lamp cost which is around 40% the cost of the projector and lamp life is yet to be seen.
customer_reviews.author: rka

product_meta.title: ViewSonic PJD7822HDL 3200 Lumens 1080p HDMI Home Theater Projector (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description: Style:Projector OnlyThe View Sonic PJD7822HDL is a Full HD high-brightness home entertainment projector. Equipped with 3200 ANSI lumens and a 15,000:1 contrast ratio, this projector can display clear, bright images even in rooms with high ambient light. In addition, a short throw lens with 1.3x optical zoom offers flexible setup options for smaller rooms. With Dual HDMI inputs and a 5V USB charging port, the PJD7822HDL offers flexible connectivity to high-definition devices, as well as compatibility with wireless HDMI dongles such as Google Chromecast. The PJD7822HDL also includes 3D Blu-ray support, integrated 2W speaker, and Super Color technology for a wider color range and true-to-life image projection.
